title: Tommyknocker 10
description: Join Zia Rides in Silver City, NM for a weekend of mountain biking, camping and hanging out with fellow mountain bikers at the Tommyknocker10. Ride as a solo, duo, or on a team with friends in this fun mountain bike relay event. Tommyknocker10 promises riders a great town, great trails, and a great venue for a weekend of fun mountain biking!
course: The Course is on the Ft. Bayard Trails outside of Silver City, NM. The course will be about 10 miles of super-fast, fun singletrack with some doubletrack mixed in mostly on the climbs.
notes: There are categories for solo, duo, and teams - male, female, and coed. Juniors are half price.
directions: The event is at Ft. Bayard, NM, just a few miles East of Silver City. Once you arrive at Ft. Bayard, just follow the signs to the staging area.

title: 12 Hours in the Wild West
description:
It’s time for a change! After 5 years at Ft. Stanton, we are moving the 12 Hours in the Wild West to the Village of Ruidoso and the Grindstone Lake Trail System. The move is awesome for many reasons: spectacular, purpose-built mountain bike trails and a great staging/camping area that will be more sheltered from the dust and wind. We will also be right in town with easy access to Ruidoso restaurants, hotels, and services. Seriously, you could roll to the start from several hotels in Ruidoso.
Come see why everyone raves about the Grindstone Lake trail system! If don’t believe me, read the reviews from MTB Project and Singletracks below. This move is going to make the 12 Hours in the Wild West your new favorite Zia Rides event.
course: The race is at the Grindstone Lake Trail System. The course will be approximately 12 miles with about 1200 feet of total climbing. The course will be ridden in a counter-clockwise direction on the outer most loop of the Grindstone system. The course gradually climbs for the first 4-5 miles. It is never really steep, and is actually a pretty fun climb winding through the trees. Once you top out on the mesa, buckle up and prepare for huge grins. For the next 6 miles or so, you will be ripping through the trees and enjoying the awesome, purpose-built, single-track flow trails that make Grindstone so much fun. Seriously, this is an awesome course!
registration:
Fees and Deadline
Early Bird: $65 per rider – register by December 31, 2015
Regular: $75 per rider – register by March 15, 2016
Late: $85 per rider – register by April 5, 2016 **Too late for free event t-shirt**
Juniors (18 & under): 1/2 price
notes:
Categories
Solo: Female, Male
Solo Single Speed: Female, Male
Solo Masters (50+): Female, Male
Duo: Female, Male, Co-ed
Teams: Female, Male, Co-ed
*Zia Rides reserves the right to combine categories when the minimum of 3 in a category is not met. Please don’t fault us for wanting to have a full podium!
directions: From NM-48 in Ruidoso, take Grindstone Canyon south to a left on Resort Rd. The venue will on the right.

title: Tour of the Gila Fun Ride
Dawn 'til Dusk - 12 Hour Endurance
description: Dawn ’til Dusk is known for a few things: 100% singletrack, killer trails designed to make you want to ride more than 12 hours, ample camping and parking right on the course, laid-back atmosphere, single speed friendly, just darn friendly overall,  and well-organized. This year we are offering a 12 hour and 6 hour option
course: This race takes place on the nationally recognized High Desert Trail System in Gallup, NM. The singletrack is superb. The course is 13 miles long and has roughly 1,600 feet of climbing. The trails are right near town, but you will feel like you are in the middle of nowhere.
registration:
www.ziarides.com/register

12 Hour Categories
Solo: Female, Male
Solo Single Speed: Female, Male
Solo Masters (50+): Female, Male
Duo: Female, Male, Co-ed
Teams: Female, Male, Co-ed

6 Hour Categories
Solo: Female, Male
Duo: Female, Male, Co-ed
notes: We have some great things happening in 2016. We have a new staging area that will be better for everyone. And, we are adding a 6 hour option for those looking to ride and have fun with less of a commitment. It is going to be a great year for Dawn ’til Dusk.
directions: Gallup is working on a new venue. Please stay tuned for the exact location of the staging area.

title: Angel Fire's Oso High XC Race
Glory Days at Glorieta, Mountain Bike State Championship
24 Hours in the Enchanted Forest
description:
24 Hours in the Enchanted Forest provides everything that you want from a 24 Hour Race. We have an amazing course with epic singletrack winding through the meadows, pines and aspens. Seriously, this is a great place to ride. We have an amazing venue in the ponderosa pines with plenty of space to hang out with friends and family. And, the event is a great party with vendors, movies, food, kids activities, and fun for everyone.

The event is a relay, and you can be as fast or as laid back as you want to be. We won’t judge. No matter what, you will have a great time. There are options for solos, duos, teams of 4 or 5, and a corporate category for teams of up to 10. So, come join us for 24 Hours in the Enchanted Forest – an amazing weekend of camping, riding, and fun!
course: The course is approximately 15 miles long. It is located among the ponderosa pines and aspens of the Zuni Mountains (just east, and up a few feet!, from Gallup, NM). But these are not your typical mountain singletrack trails; this course is all smiles with only a couple of short steep climbs. In one word: flowy. It rips and rolls through the finest singletrack west of the Mississippi (in our humble opinion) onto Turkey Nest, Smokin’ Handlebar, Burma, Quaking Aspen, and lower Y2K. There is about a one mile connector to get to the McGaffey Campground, our home sweet home for the weekend.
registration:
Register at: http://ziarides.com/event-register/24-hours-in-the-enchanted-forest/
Categories include:
Solo: Female, Male
Solo Single Speed: Female, Male
Solo Masters (50+): Female, Male
Duo: Female, Male, Co-ed
Teams of 4: Female, Male
Teams of 5: Co-ed
Juniors: Team of 4
Corporate: up to 10 riders
Enchantedland: up to 6 riders (only two adults per team, shortened 5 mile course. See below.)

*Zia Rides reserves the right to combine categories when the minimum of 3 in a category is not met. Please don’t fault us for wanting to have a full podium!
directions: The race is at McGaffey Campground on NM-400. From I-40, take exit 33, for Fort Wingate, NM. Head South on NM-400 for 11 miles to the McGaffey Campground.

title: Las Campanas Classic Regional Road Race Championship
description: 2016 Las Campanas Classic New Mexico State/Regional Championship
course: The course will be an 8.8 mile loop around the Las Campanas sub-division Northwest of downtown Santa Fe.  This years race will travel in a counter clockwise direction.  The start and finish line will be located in the same area this year and will be a quarter mile from awards and lunch at 437 Las campanas Drive.
registration: There will be no race day registration. Online registration at USAC is $35 through June 12th, $45 through June 16th and $55 late registration at Bike N Sport, 524 C Cordova, Santa Fe, Friday, June 17th from 2-5 PM and Saturday, June 18th from 1-3 PM. A one day license may be purchased for $10.00 and be permitted to enter races open to men's category 5 or women's category 4.
notes: Awards- Medals will be awarded to NMBRA Members, with annual licenses, in all cat's for top 3 finishers in each licensed event. NMBRA members are residents of New Mexico or El Paso, TX. the awards ceremony will take place in one of the shelters at the race start area at 437 Las Campanas Drive after the results are posted and a 15 minute protest period. For more information contact race director Wendell t. Egelhoff at 505-699-8838 or at tegelhoff@clublc.com
directions: Race headquarters is at the Club at Las Campanas Sunset Golf Course Maintenance Building, 437 Las Campanas Drive. I-25 to 599 take the La Tierra/Las Campanas exit.  Continue on La Tierra, follow signs for Las Campanas Drive past Clubhouse and continue to 437 Las Campanas Drive.  Parking, restrooms and showers are located at the Golf Course Maintenance building.

address.street: Taos Youth & Family Center, 407 Paseo del Cañon East, Taos, NM 87571

title: South Boundary BigRide
description: Zia Rides is adding a new race and new event format in 2016 – The Innagural South Boundary BigRide. The South Boundary BigRide will be an absolutely stunning 40 mile mostly singletrack ride from Angel Fire Resort to Taos Youth and Family Center on the South Boundary Trail. The South Bouandary trail is arguably the best ride in New Mexico and probably one of the top rides in the whole country with beautiful high alpine views and amazing aspen forests. It will be a perfect warm up for those training for Leadville, as the course tops out at nearly 11,000 feet!
course: The course is 40 miles of backcountry singletrack bliss. The first 4 miles is on a road, followed by 3.5 miles of forest road. After that, the singletrack begins and doesn't end until you arrive in Taos, NM.
registration:
Early registration ends on May 31.
Regular registration ends on June 30.
Late registration ends on July 26.
notes: There will be an optional shuttle from Taos back to Angel Fire for $25.
directions: The race begins at Angel Fire Resort. The race finishes at the Taos Youth and Family Center.

title: Santa Fe Hillclimb
description: Santa Fe Hillclimb, from downtown Santa fe to the Ski Santa Fe ski area
notes: No personal support cars due to traffic considerations. Cars must either proceed the racers or stay behind everyone. There will be a sweep car.
directions: Start is at the Fort Marcy Recreation Complex. Take St Francis Drive north from I-25, then take a right on Paseo De Peralta, then a left at Washington/Bishop's Lodge rd, start is on the left.

title: Paula Higgins Memorial 2016 Record  Challenge TT
Squash Blossom Classic - Screamer XC Mountain Bike Race
12 Hours of Albuquerque and MTB Fest
description: We will be taking over the Oak Flat Group area just outside of Albuquerque on September 24-25, 2016 for a fun weekend of racing, riding, and family-friendly fun. The weekend will be full of activities with the anchor event being the 12 Hours of Albuquerque from 7am to 7pm on Saturday. We expect this race to sell out, so sign up early!
course:
The 12 Hour Course is 11.6 miles, has about 1250 feet of climbing and travels between 7,300ft and 7,700ft above sea level. It is an alpine course in the Ponderosa Pines above Albuquerque. The course has some wide open fast sections of flowy singletrack, a few tough climbs, as well as the occasional technical/rocky section of trail.

The course will take advantage of the trails in the Pine Flats and Oak Flats areas including: Oak Flat Connector, Deadman, Pine Loop, Pine Flat Connector, Gamble Oak, Pokerchip, Caida Del Pino, Mahogany, Easy Pickin’, and Ponderosa.The course will travel in a clockwise direction.

The 2 Hour Course is approximately 6 miles long, and is beginner friendly. It follows much of the Ponderosa loop from Oak Flat. There will also be a 3 mile loop for younger riders.
registration:
Registration Opens: June 1
Early Registration ends: June 30
Regular Registration ends: August 30
Late Registration ends: September 20
notes: There is also the family-friendly 2 Hours of Albuquerque that will be part of this event. This is separate from the free kids race.
directions: From Albuquerque: Go East on I-40. From I-40 and Tramway Blvd, the distance to the Tijeras exit is about 6.5 miles. Take Exit 175 – Tijeras. On exit ramp, bear right and then enter center lane. Go straight at the stop light. This is Hwy 337. Go South on Hwy 337 8.6 miles, ascending Tijeras Canyon. Watch for the Oak Flats sign on the Right as you come up out of the canyon. Turn Left on Oak Flat Rd and go 0.9 miles. Turn Left into Oak Flat Campground.

title: 2 Hours of Albuquerque
description: The 2 Hours of Albuquerque is an event that is great for beginners and families. It is part of the Albuquerque Mountain Bike Festival and allows for folks that are supporting the 12 Hour racers to have a little race of their own.
course: The course is on the beginner friendly Ponderosa loop from Oak Flat Group Area. There is a 3 mile option and a 6 mile option.
registration:
Registration is $30 and will include a t-shirt, glass, and prize.
Register online at:
https://app.lap.io/event/2016-09-12-hours-of-albuquerque/register
directions: Oak Flat Group Area off of Oak Flat Rd in Tijeras, NM.

title: Western Town CycloCross at Glorieta Camps Produce by CORE Crew
description: CycloCross returns to Glorieta Camps. This year we will be located at the southern end of the Camp in Western Town. We will be part of the NMCX Series, please go to www.nmcyclocross.com for more information.
course: The course will be a mix of all your typical CX surfaces, grass, gravel, asphalt, with some up and downs and maybe even some mud depending on the weather.
directions: Take Glorieta exit off I25 heading north towards Las Vegas, NM, about 15 miles north of Santa Fe turn left crossing over the interstate and then turn left again at State Road 50 and go about 1/2 mile to Glorieta Camps. You will be required to sign a waiver to enter the Camp property.

title: Tour of Las Cruces
description: Tour Ride around the Mesilla Valley
course: 50 KM or 100 KM moderately paced tour event
directions: The Tour of Las Cruces begins and ends at Memorial Medical Center on Telshor Avenue.

title: Fiesta CX race presented by Sport Systems
description: Fiesta CX Race presented by Sport Systems
course: Course will be a approximate 1 mile loop on the North Side of Balloon Fiesta park.
registration: You can register on line @ http://newmexicosportsonline.com
notes:
Start	Categories	Duration	Awards
8:30 AM	Course Open for Practice	30 min	 
9:00AM	Men Masters , 40+,50+,60+,Single Speed, Women Open, Women Collegiate A	40 min	 
10:00 AM	Women : Masters 40+,50+,60+,Cat3,4, Junior 17-18,Single Speed, Collegiate B,C	40 min	 
1!:00 AM	Junior Boys and Girls, 9-10,11-12,13-14,15-16	30 min	 
11:30 AM	Open Course and awards for Races 1-3	30 min	 
12:00 PM	Men:  Open and Collegiate A	60 min	 
1:15PM	Men:  4,5, Junior 17-18, Collegiate B,C	40 min	 
2:00 PM	Awards Races 4 and 5
directions:
Balloon Fiesta Park - 5500 Balloon Fiesta Parkway, Albuquerque, NM 87113.
From I-25/I-40 intersection
Take I -25 going north and take exit 234 Roy-Tramway.  Make a left turn, go underneath the bridge, and make a left turn at the light.  Stay on the Frontage road, going South, and make a first right @ Balloon Fiesta Parkway. Drive to the end of the street until the gate, where you will be able to park.  The CX course will be directly in front of the parking lot.

title: Cruces 'Cross
description: Cruces Cross (Cyclo-Cross Race in Southern New Mexico)
